com.github.nosan.embedded.cassandra.configuration

Interface Config


  • public interface Config
    Configuration properties for Apache Cassandra.
    Author:
    Dmytro Nosan
    See Also:
    See more..., Config.Builder

      static interface  Config.Builder
      Builds instances of type Config.

      Enable or disable whether a snapshot is taken of the data before keyspace truncation or dropping of tables.
      Boolean getBackPressureEnabled()
      Back-pressure settings (If enabled) the coordinator will apply the back-pressure strategy specified below to each mutation sent to replicas, with the aim of reducing pressure on overloaded replicas.
      ParameterizedClass getBackPressureStrategy()
      The backpressure strategy.
      Integer getBatchlogReplayThrottleInKb()
      Total maximum throttle for replaying hints.
      Integer getBatchSizeFailThresholdInKb()
      Fail any multiple-partition batch exceeding this value.
      Integer getBatchSizeWarnThresholdInKb()
      Log WARN on any batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes.
      String getBroadcastAddress()
      The IP address a node tells other nodes in the cluster to contact it by.
      String getBroadcastRpcAddress()
      RPC address to broadcast to drivers and other Cassandra nodes.
      Boolean getBufferPoolUseHeapIfExhausted()
      ﻿Indicates whether Cassandra allocates allocate on-heap or off-heap memory when the SSTable buffer pool is exhausted (when the buffer pool has exceeded the maximum memory file_cache_size_in_mb), beyond this amount, Cassandra stops caching buffers, but allocates on request.
      Long getCasContentionTimeoutInMs()
      How long a coordinator should continue to retry a CAS operation that contends with other proposals for the same row.
      Boolean getCdcEnabled()
      Enable / disable CDC functionality on a per-node basis.
      Long getCdcFreeSpaceCheckIntervalMs()
      When we hit our cdc_raw limit and the CDCCompactor is either running behind or experiencing backpressure, we check at the following interval to see if any new space for cdc-tracked tables has been made available.
      String getCdcRawDirectory()
      The directory where the CDC log is stored.
      Integer getCdcTotalSpaceInMb()
      Total space to use for change-data-capture logs on disk.
      ClientEncryptionOptions getClientEncryptionOptions()
      Enables or disables client-to-node encryption.
      String getClusterName()
      The name of the cluster.
      Integer getColumnIndexCacheSizeInKb()
      Granularity of the index of rows within a partition.
      Integer getColumnIndexSizeInKb()
      Granularity of the collation index of rows within a partition.
      CommitFailurePolicy getCommitFailurePolicy()
      Policy for commit disk failures.
      ParameterizedClass getCommitlogCompression()
      Compression to apply to the commit log.
      String getCommitlogDirectory()
      The directory where the commit log is stored.
      Long getCommitlogSegmentSizeInMb()
      the size of the individual commitlog file segments.
      CommitLogSync getCommitlogSync()
      Policy for commit log sync.
      Double getCommitlogSyncBatchWindowInMs()
      When in batch mode, Cassandra won’t ack writes until the commit log has been fsynced to disk.
      Long getCommitlogSyncPeriodInMs()
      When in periodic mode, the CommitLog is simply synced every getCommitlogSyncPeriodInMs.
      Integer getCommitlogTotalSpaceInMb()
      Total space used for commitlogs.
      Integer getCompactionLargePartitionWarningThresholdMb()
      Log a warning when compacting partitions larger than this value.
      Integer getCompactionThroughputMbPerSec()
      Throttles compaction to the given total throughput across the entire system.
      Integer getConcurrentCompactors()
      the number of concurrent compaction processes allowed to run simultaneously on a node, not including validation compactions for anti-entropy repair.
      Integer getConcurrentCounterWrites()
      Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back.
      Integer getConcurrentMaterializedViewWrites()
      For materialized view writes, as there is a read involved, so this should be limited by the less of concurrent reads or concurrent writes.
      Integer getConcurrentReads()
      For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk.
      Integer getConcurrentWrites()
      Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system.
      Integer getCounterCacheKeysToSave()
      Number of keys from the counter cache to save.
      Long getCounterCacheSavePeriod()
      Duration after which Cassandra should save the counter cache (keys only).
      Integer getCounterCacheSizeInMb()
      When no value is specified a minimum of 2.5% of Heap or 50MB.
      Long getCounterWriteRequestTimeoutInMs()
      How long the coordinator should wait for counter writes to complete.
      Integer getCredentialsCacheMaxEntries()
      Max entries of credentials cache.
      Long getCredentialsUpdateIntervalInMs()
      Refresh interval for credentials cache (if enabled).
      Long getCredentialsValidityInMs()
      Validity period for credentials cache.
      Boolean getCrossNodeTimeout()
      Enable operation timeout information exchange between nodes to accurately measure request timeouts.
      Collection<String> getDataFileDirectories()
      Directories where Cassandra should store data on disk.

      Policy for data disk access mode.
      DiskFailurePolicy getDiskFailurePolicy()
      Policy for data disk failures.
      DiskOptimizationStrategy getDiskOptimizationStrategy()
      The strategy for optimizing disk read.
      Double getDynamicSnitchBadnessThreshold()
      The performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node.
      Long getDynamicSnitchResetIntervalInMs()
      Time interval after which Cassandra resets all node scores.
      Long getDynamicSnitchUpdateIntervalInMs()
      The number of milliseconds between Cassandra's calculation of node scores.
      Boolean getEnableScriptedUserDefinedFunctions()
      Enables scripted UDFs (JavaScript UDFs).
      Boolean getEnableUserDefinedFunctions()
      If unset, all GC Pauses greater than gc_log_threshold_in_ms will log at INFO level UDFs (user defined functions) are disabled by default.
      String getEndpointSnitch()
      Set to a class that implements the IEndpointSnitch interface.
      Integer getFileCacheSizeInMb()
      Total memory to use for SSTable-reading buffers.
      Long getGcLogThresholdInMs()
      GC Pauses greater than 200 ms will be logged at INFO level This threshold can be adjusted to minimize logging if necessary.
      Long getGcWarnThresholdInMs()
      GC Pauses greater than gc_warn_threshold_in_ms will be logged at WARN level Adjust the threshold based on your application throughput requirement.
      Collection<String> getHintedHandoffDisabledDatacenters()
      A blacklist of datacenters that will not perform hinted handoffs.

      Enables or disables hinted handoff.

      Compression to apply to the hint files.

      Directory where Cassandra should store hints.

      Backs up data updated since the last snapshot was taken.

      Fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries.

      Used in the single-node-per-token architecture, where a node owns exactly one contiguous range in the ring space.

      JMX port.

      Number of keys from the key cache to save.
      Long getKeyCacheSavePeriod()
      Duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache.
      Integer getKeyCacheSizeInMb()
      A global cache setting for tables.
      String getListenAddress()
      Address or interface to bind to and tell other Cassandra nodes to connect to.
      String getListenInterface()
      Listen Interface must correspond to a single address, IP aliasing is not supported.
      Boolean getListenInterfacePreferIpv6()
      If you choose to specify the interface by name and the interface has an ipv4 and an ipv6 address you can specify which should be chosen using listen_interface_prefer_ipv6.
      Boolean getListenOnBroadcastAddress()
      When using multiple physical network interfaces, set this to true to listen on broadcast_address in addition to the listen_address, allowing nodes to communicate in both interfaces.
      Integer getMaxHintsDeliveryThreads()
      Number of threads Cassandra uses to deliver hints.

      The maximum size for a single hints file, in megabytes.

      Maximum amount of time during which Cassandra generates hints for an unresponsive node.

      If a mutation's size exceeds this value, the mutation is rejected.
      Integer getMaxValueSizeInMb()
      Maximum size of any value in SSTables.

      Ratio used for automatic memtable flush.

      the number of memtable flush writer threads.

      Port for the CQL native transport to listen for clients on.

      Enabling native transport encryption.

      Defines the number of tokens randomly assigned to this node on the ring when using virtual nodes (vnodes).
      Long getOtcBacklogExpirationIntervalMs()
      How many milliseconds to wait between two expiration runs on the backlog (queue) of the OutboundTcpConnection.
      Integer getOtcCoalescingEnoughCoalescedMessages()
      Do not try to coalesce messages if we already got that many messages.
      String getOtcCoalescingStrategy()
      Strategy to use for coalescing messages in OutboundTcpConnection.
      Long getOtcCoalescingWindowUs()
      How many microseconds to wait for coalescing.
      String getPartitioner()
      The partitioner is responsible for distributing groups of rows (by partition key) across nodes in the cluster.
      Integer getPermissionsCacheMaxEntries()
      Max entries of permissions cache.
      Long getPermissionsUpdateIntervalInMs()
      Refresh interval for permissions cache (if enabled).
      Long getPermissionsValidityInMs()
      Validity period for permissions cache.

      Adjusts the sensitivity of the failure detector on an exponential scale.

      Maximum size of the native protocol prepared statement cache.

      How long the coordinator should wait for seq or index scans to complete.
      Long getReadRequestTimeoutInMs()
      How long the coordinator should wait for read operations to complete.

      Defines a scheduler to handle incoming client requests according to a defined policy.

      Policy for request scheduler id.

      A list of properties that define configuration options for request_scheduler.

      The default timeout for other, miscellaneous operations.

      RoleManager, used to work with roles.

      Max entries of roles cache.
      Long getRolesUpdateIntervalInMs()
      Refresh interval for roles cache (if enabled).
      Long getRolesValidityInMs()
      Validity period for roles cache.

      The classname of the row cache provider to use.
      Integer getRowCacheKeysToSave()
      Number of keys from the row cache to save.
      Long getRowCacheSavePeriod()
      Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache.
      Integer getRowCacheSizeInMb()
      Maximum size of the row cache in memory.

      The address or interface to bind the native transport server to.
      String getRpcInterface()
      RPC interfaces must correspond to a single address, IP aliasing is not supported.

      If you choose to specify the interface by name and the interface has an ipv4 and an ipv6 address you can specify which should be chosen using rpc_interface_prefer_ipv6.
      Boolean getRpcKeepalive()
      Enable or disable keepalive on rpc/native connections.
      String getSavedCachesDirectory()
      The directory location where table key and row caches are stored.
      ParameterizedClass getSeedProvider()
      The addresses of hosts designated as contact points in the cluster.
      ServerEncryptionOptions getServerEncryptionOptions()
      Enables or disables inter-node encryption.
      Long getSlowQueryLogTimeoutInMs()
      How long before a node logs slow queries.
      Boolean getSnapshotBeforeCompaction()
      Enable or disable taking a snapshot before each compaction.
      int getSslStoragePort()
      SSL port, for encrypted communication.
      Integer getSstablePreemptiveOpenIntervalInMb()
      When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written.
      Boolean getStartNativeTransport()
      Start the native transport or not.
      int getStoragePort()
      The port for inter-node communication.
      Long getStreamingKeepAlivePeriodInSecs()
      Set keep-alive period for streaming This node will send a keep-alive message periodically with this period.
      Long getStreamingSocketTimeoutInMs()
      Enable or disable socket timeout for streaming operations.
      Integer getStreamThroughputOutboundMegabitsPerSec()
      Throttles all outbound streaming file transfers on a node to the specified throughput.
      Integer getTombstoneFailureThreshold()
      The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.
      Integer getTombstoneWarnThreshold()
      The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before warning.
      Long getTracetypeQueryTtl()
      TTL for different trace types used during logging of the repair process.
      Long getTracetypeRepairTtl()
      TTL for different trace types used during logging of the repair process.
      TransparentDataEncryptionOptions getTransparentDataEncryptionOptions()
      Enables encrypting data at-rest (on disk).
      Boolean getTrickleFsync()
      When doing sequential writing, enabling this option tells fsync to force the operating system to flush the dirty buffers at a set interval trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb.
      Integer getTrickleFsyncIntervalInKb()
      Size of the fsync in kilobytes.
      Long getTruncateRequestTimeoutInMs()
      How long the coordinator should wait for truncates to complete.
      Integer getUnloggedBatchAcrossPartitionsWarnThreshold()
      Log WARN on any batches not of type LOGGED than span across more partitions than this limit.
      Integer getWindowsTimerInterval()
      The default Windows kernel timer and scheduling resolution is 15.6ms for power conservation.
      Long getWriteRequestTimeoutInMs()
      How long the coordinator should wait for writes to complete.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllocateTokensForKeyspace

        @Nullable
String getAllocateTokensForKeyspace()
        Triggers automatic allocation of num_tokens tokens for this node. The allocation algorithm attempts to choose tokens in a way that optimizes replicated load over the nodes in the datacenter for the replication strategy used by the specified keyspace.
        Returns:
        The value of the allocateTokensForKeyspace attribute

      • getJmxPort

        int getJmxPort()
        JMX port.
        Returns:
        The value of the jmxPort attribute

      • getStreamingSocketTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getStreamingSocketTimeoutInMs()
        Enable or disable socket timeout for streaming operations. When a timeout occurs during streaming, streaming is retried from the start of the current file. Avoid setting this value too low, as it can result in a significant amount of data re-streaming.
        Returns:
        The value of the streamingSocketTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getClusterName

        @Nullable
String getClusterName()
        The name of the cluster. This is mainly used to prevent machines in one logical cluster from joining another.
        Returns:
        The value of the clusterName attribute

      • getCredentialsValidityInMs

        @Nullable
Long getCredentialsValidityInMs()
        Validity period for credentials cache. This cache is tightly coupled to the provided PasswordAuthenticator implementation of IAuthenticator. If another IAuthenticator implementation is configured, this cache will not be automatically used and so the following settings will have no effect.
        Returns:
        The value of the credentialsValidityInMs attribute

Long getCredentialsUpdateIntervalInMs()
        Refresh interval for credentials cache (if enabled). After this interval, cache entries become eligible for refresh.

        The value of the credentialsUpdateIntervalInMs attribute

      • getPartitioner

        @Nullable
String getPartitioner()
        The partitioner is responsible for distributing groups of rows (by partition key) across nodes in the cluster.

        Besides Murmur3Partitioner, partitioner included for backwards compatibility include RandomPartitioner, ByteOrderedPartitioner, and OrderPreservingPartitioner.

        Returns:
        The value of the partitioner attribute

      • getAutoBootstrap

        @Nullable
Boolean getAutoBootstrap()
        This setting has been removed from default configuration. It makes new (non-seed) nodes automatically migrate the right data to themselves. When initializing a fresh cluster without data, add auto_bootstrap: false.
        Returns:
        The value of the autoBootstrap attribute

      • getHintedHandoffEnabled

        @Nullable
Boolean getHintedHandoffEnabled()
        Enables or disables hinted handoff. To enable per datacenter, add a list of datacenters. For example: hinted_handoff_enabled: DC1,DC2. A hint indicates that the write needs to be replayed to an unavailable node. Cassandra writes the hint to a hints file on the coordinator node.
        Returns:
        The value of the hintedHandoffEnabled attribute

      • getHintedHandoffDisabledDatacenters

        @Nullable
Collection<String> getHintedHandoffDisabledDatacenters()
        A blacklist of datacenters that will not perform hinted handoffs. To disable hinted handoff on a certain datacenter, add its name to this list.
        Returns:
        The value of the hintedHandoffDisabledDatacenters attribute

      • getMaxHintWindowInMs

        @Nullable
Long getMaxHintWindowInMs()
        Maximum amount of time during which Cassandra generates hints for an unresponsive node. After this interval, Cassandra does not generate any new hints for the node until it is back up and responsive. If the node goes down again, Cassandra starts a new interval. This setting can prevent a sudden demand for resources when a node is brought back online and the rest of the cluster attempts to replay a large volume of hinted writes.
        Returns:
        The value of the maxHintWindowInMs attribute

      • getHintsDirectory

        @Nullable
String getHintsDirectory()
        Directory where Cassandra should store hints.
        Returns:
        The value of the hintsDirectory attribute

      • getSeedProvider

        @Nullable
ParameterizedClass getSeedProvider()
        The addresses of hosts designated as contact points in the cluster. A joining node contacts one of the nodes in the -seeds list to learn the topology of the ring.
        Returns:
        The value of the seedProvider attribute

      • getDiskFailurePolicy

        @Nullable
DiskFailurePolicy getDiskFailurePolicy()
        Policy for data disk failures.
        Returns:
        The value of the diskFailurePolicy attribute

      • getCommitFailurePolicy

        @Nullable
CommitFailurePolicy getCommitFailurePolicy()
        Policy for commit disk failures.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitFailurePolicy attribute

      • getInitialToken

        @Nullable
String getInitialToken()
        Used in the single-node-per-token architecture, where a node owns exactly one contiguous range in the ring space. Setting this property overrides num_tokens.
        Returns:
        The value of the initialToken attribute

      • getNumTokens

        @Nullable
Integer getNumTokens()
        Defines the number of tokens randomly assigned to this node on the ring when using virtual nodes (vnodes). The more tokens, relative to other nodes, the larger the proportion of data that the node stores. Generally all nodes should have the same number of tokens assuming equal hardware capability. The recommended value is 256.
        Returns:
        The value of the numTokens attribute

      • getAllocateTokensForLocalReplicationFactor

        @Nullable
String getAllocateTokensForLocalReplicationFactor()
        When adding a vnode to an existing cluster or setting up nodes in a new datacenter, set to the target replication factor (RF) of keyspaces in the datacenter. Triggers algorithmic allocation for the RF and num_tokens for this node. The allocation algorithm attempts to choose tokens in a way that optimizes replicated load over the nodes in the datacenter for the specified RF. The load assigned to each node is close to proportional to the number of vnodes.
        Returns:
        The value of the allocateTokensForLocalReplicationFactor attribute

      • getRequestTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getRequestTimeoutInMs()
        The default timeout for other, miscellaneous operations.
        Returns:
        The value of the requestTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getReadRequestTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getReadRequestTimeoutInMs()
        How long the coordinator should wait for read operations to complete.
        Returns:
        The value of the readRequestTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getRangeRequestTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getRangeRequestTimeoutInMs()
        How long the coordinator should wait for seq or index scans to complete.
        Returns:
        The value of the rangeRequestTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getWriteRequestTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getWriteRequestTimeoutInMs()
        How long the coordinator should wait for writes to complete.
        Returns:
        The value of the writeRequestTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getCounterWriteRequestTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getCounterWriteRequestTimeoutInMs()
        How long the coordinator should wait for counter writes to complete.
        Returns:
        The value of the counterWriteRequestTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getCasContentionTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getCasContentionTimeoutInMs()
        How long a coordinator should continue to retry a CAS operation that contends with other proposals for the same row.
        Returns:
        The value of the casContentionTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getTruncateRequestTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getTruncateRequestTimeoutInMs()
        How long the coordinator should wait for truncates to complete.
        Returns:
        The value of the truncateRequestTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getStreamingKeepAlivePeriodInSecs

        @Nullable
Long getStreamingKeepAlivePeriodInSecs()
        Set keep-alive period for streaming This node will send a keep-alive message periodically with this period. If the node does not receive a keep-alive message from the peer for 2 keep-alive cycles the stream session times out and fail Default value is 300s (5 minutes), which means stalled stream times out in 10 minutes by default.
        Returns:
        The value of the streamingKeepAlivePeriodInSecs attribute

      • getCrossNodeTimeout

        @Nullable
Boolean getCrossNodeTimeout()
        Enable operation timeout information exchange between nodes to accurately measure request timeouts. If disabled, replicas will assume that requests were forwarded to them instantly by the coordinator, which means that under overload conditions we will waste that much extra time processing already-timed-out requests.
        Returns:
        The value of the crossNodeTimeout attribute

      • getSlowQueryLogTimeoutInMs

        @Nullable
Long getSlowQueryLogTimeoutInMs()
        How long before a node logs slow queries. Select queries that take longer than this timeout to execute, will generate an aggregated log message, so that slow queries can be identified. Set this value to zero to disable slow query logging.
        Returns:
        The value of the slowQueryLogTimeoutInMs attribute

      • getPhiConvictThreshold

        @Nullable
Double getPhiConvictThreshold()
        Adjusts the sensitivity of the failure detector on an exponential scale. Generally this setting never needs adjusting.
        Returns:
        The value of the phiConvictThreshold attribute

      • getConcurrentReads

        @Nullable
Integer getConcurrentReads()
        For workloads with more data than can fit in memory, the bottleneck is reads fetching data from disk. Setting to (16 × number_of_drives) allows operations to queue low enough in the stack so that the OS and drives can reorder them. The default setting applies to both logical volume managed (LVM) and RAID drive.
        Returns:
        The value of the concurrentReads attribute

      • getConcurrentWrites

        @Nullable
Integer getConcurrentWrites()
        Writes in Cassandra are rarely I/O bound, so the ideal number of concurrent writes depends on the number of CPU cores in your system. The recommended value is 8 × number_of_cpu_cores.
        Returns:
        The value of the concurrentWrites attribute

      • getConcurrentCounterWrites

        @Nullable
Integer getConcurrentCounterWrites()
        Counter writes read the current values before incrementing and writing them back. The recommended value is (16 × number_of_drives).
        Returns:
        The value of the concurrentCounterWrites attribute

      • getConcurrentMaterializedViewWrites

        @Nullable
Integer getConcurrentMaterializedViewWrites()
        For materialized view writes, as there is a read involved, so this should be limited by the less of concurrent reads or concurrent writes.
        Returns:
        The value of the concurrentMaterializedViewWrites attribute

      • getMemtableFlushWriters

        @Nullable
Integer getMemtableFlushWriters()
        the number of memtable flush writer threads. These threads are blocked by disk I/O, and each one holds a memtable in memory while blocked. If your data directories are backed by SSD, increase this setting to the number of cores.
        Returns:
        The value of the memtableFlushWriters attribute

      • getMemtableHeapSpaceInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getMemtableHeapSpaceInMb()
        Total permitted memory to use for memtables. Cassandra will stop accepting writes when the limit is exceeded until a flush completes, and will trigger a flush based on memtable_cleanup_threshold If omitted, Cassandra will set both to 1/4 the size of the heap.
        Returns:
        The value of the memtableHeapSpaceInMb attribute

      • getMemtableOffheapSpaceInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getMemtableOffheapSpaceInMb()
        A threshold for automatic memtable flush.
        Returns:
        The value of the memtableOffheapSpaceInMb attribute

      • getMemtableCleanupThreshold

        @Nullable
Double getMemtableCleanupThreshold()
        Ratio used for automatic memtable flush. Casssandra adds memtable_heap_space_in_mb to memtable_offheap_space_in_mb and multiplies the total by memtable_cleanup_threshold to get a space amount in MB. When the total amount of memory being used by all non-flushing memtables exceeds this amount, Casandra flushes the largest memtable to disk.
        Returns:
        The value of the memtableCleanupThreshold attribute

      • getStoragePort

        int getStoragePort()
        The port for inter-node communication.
        Returns:
        The value of the storagePort attribute

      • getSslStoragePort

        int getSslStoragePort()
        SSL port, for encrypted communication. Unused unless enabled in encryption_options For security reasons, you should not expose this port to the internet. Firewall it if needed.
        Returns:
        The value of the sslStoragePort attribute

      • getListenAddress

        @Nullable
String getListenAddress()
        Address or interface to bind to and tell other Cassandra nodes to connect to. Set listenAddress OR listenInterface, not both.
        Returns:
        The value of the listenAddress attribute

      • getListenInterface

        @Nullable
String getListenInterface()
        Listen Interface must correspond to a single address, IP aliasing is not supported.
        Returns:
        The value of the listenInterface attribute

      • getListenInterfacePreferIpv6

        @Nullable
Boolean getListenInterfacePreferIpv6()
        If you choose to specify the interface by name and the interface has an ipv4 and an ipv6 address you can specify which should be chosen using listen_interface_prefer_ipv6. If false the first ipv4 address will be used. If true the first ipv6 address will be used. Defaults to false preferring ipv4. If there is only one address it will be selected regardless of ipv4/ipv6.
        Returns:
        The value of the listenInterfacePreferIpv6 attribute

      • getBroadcastAddress

        @Nullable
String getBroadcastAddress()
        The IP address a node tells other nodes in the cluster to contact it by. It allows public and private address to be different. For example, use the broadcast_address parameter in topologies where not all nodes have access to other nodes by their private IP addresses.
        Returns:
        The value of the broadcastAddress attribute

      • getListenOnBroadcastAddress

        @Nullable
Boolean getListenOnBroadcastAddress()
        When using multiple physical network interfaces, set this to true to listen on broadcast_address in addition to the listen_address, allowing nodes to communicate in both interfaces. Ignore this property if the network configuration automatically routes between the public and private networks such as EC2.
        Returns:
        The value of the listenOnBroadcastAddress attribute

      • getInternodeAuthenticator

        @Nullable
String getInternodeAuthenticator()
        Internode authentication, used to allow/disallow connections from peer nodes.
        Returns:
        The value of the internodeAuthenticator attribute

      • getRpcAddress

        @Nullable
String getRpcAddress()

        Returns:

      • getRpcInterface

        @Nullable
String getRpcInterface()
        RPC interfaces must correspond to a single address, IP aliasing is not supported.
        Returns:
        The value of the rpcInterface attribute

      • getRpcInterfacePreferIpv6

        @Nullable
Boolean getRpcInterfacePreferIpv6()
        If you choose to specify the interface by name and the interface has an ipv4 and an ipv6 address you can specify which should be chosen using rpc_interface_prefer_ipv6. If false the first ipv4 address will be used. If true the first ipv6 address will be used. Defaults to false preferring ipv4. If there is only one address it will be selected regardless of ipv4/ipv6.
        Returns:
        The value of the rpcInterfacePreferIpv6 attribute

      • getBroadcastRpcAddress

        @Nullable
String getBroadcastRpcAddress()
        RPC address to broadcast to drivers and other Cassandra nodes. This cannot be set to 0.0.0.0. If left blank, this will be set to the value of rpc_address. If rpc_address is set to 0.0.0.0, broadcast_rpc_address must be set.
        Returns:
        The value of the broadcastRpcAddress attribute

      • getMaxValueSizeInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getMaxValueSizeInMb()
        Maximum size of any value in SSTables. Safety measure to detect SSTable corruption early. Any value size larger than this threshold will result into marking an SSTable as corrupted.
        Returns:
        The value of the maxValueSizeInMb attribute

      • getSnapshotBeforeCompaction

        @Nullable
Boolean getSnapshotBeforeCompaction()
        Enable or disable taking a snapshot before each compaction. This option is useful to back up data when there is a data format change. Be careful using this option because Cassandra does not clean up older snapshots automatically.
        Returns:
        The value of the snapshotBeforeCompaction attribute

      • getAutoSnapshot

        @Nullable
Boolean getAutoSnapshot()
        Enable or disable whether a snapshot is taken of the data before keyspace truncation or dropping of tables. To prevent data loss, using the default setting is strongly advised. If you set to false, you will lose data on truncation or drop.
        Returns:
        The value of the autoSnapshot attribute

      • getColumnIndexSizeInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getColumnIndexSizeInKb()
        Granularity of the collation index of rows within a partition. Increase if your rows are large, or if you have a very large number of rows per partition.
        Returns:
        The value of the columnIndexSizeInKb attribute

      • getColumnIndexCacheSizeInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getColumnIndexCacheSizeInKb()
        Granularity of the index of rows within a partition. For huge rows, decrease this setting to improve seek time. If you use key cache, be careful not to make this setting too large because key cache will be overwhelmed. If you're unsure of the size of the rows, it's best to use the default setting.
        Returns:
        The value of the columnIndexCacheSizeInKb attribute

      • getBatchSizeWarnThresholdInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getBatchSizeWarnThresholdInKb()
        Log WARN on any batch size exceeding this value in kilobytes. Caution should be taken on increasing the size of this threshold as it can lead to node instability.
        Returns:
        The value of the batchSizeWarnThresholdInKb attribute

      • getBatchSizeFailThresholdInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getBatchSizeFailThresholdInKb()
        Fail any multiple-partition batch exceeding this value.
        Returns:
        The value of the batchSizeFailThresholdInKb attribute

      • getUnloggedBatchAcrossPartitionsWarnThreshold

        @Nullable
Integer getUnloggedBatchAcrossPartitionsWarnThreshold()
        Log WARN on any batches not of type LOGGED than span across more partitions than this limit.
        Returns:
        The value of the unloggedBatchAcrossPartitionsWarnThreshold attribute

      • getConcurrentCompactors

        @Nullable
Integer getConcurrentCompactors()
        the number of concurrent compaction processes allowed to run simultaneously on a node, not including validation compactions for anti-entropy repair. Simultaneous compactions help preserve read performance in a mixed read-write workload by mitigating the tendency of small SSTables to accumulate during a single long-running compaction. If your data directories are backed by SSD, increase this value to the number of cores. If compaction running too slowly or too fast, adjust compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec first.
        Returns:
        The value of the concurrentCompactors attribute

      • getCompactionThroughputMbPerSec

        @Nullable
Integer getCompactionThroughputMbPerSec()
        Throttles compaction to the given total throughput across the entire system. The faster you insert data, the faster you need to compact in order to keep the sstable count down, but in general, setting this to 16 to 32 times the rate you are inserting data is more than sufficient. Setting this to 0 disables throttling. Note that this account for all types of compaction, including validation compaction.
        Returns:
        The value of the compactionThroughputMbPerSec attribute

      • getCompactionLargePartitionWarningThresholdMb

        @Nullable
Integer getCompactionLargePartitionWarningThresholdMb()
        Log a warning when compacting partitions larger than this value.
        Returns:
        The value of the compactionLargePartitionWarningThresholdMb attribute

      • getStreamThroughputOutboundMegabitsPerSec

        @Nullable
Integer getStreamThroughputOutboundMegabitsPerSec()
        Throttles all outbound streaming file transfers on a node to the specified throughput. Cassandra does mostly sequential I/O when streaming data during bootstrap or repair, which can lead to saturating the network connection and degrading client (RPC) performance.
        Returns:
        The value of the streamThroughputOutboundMegabitsPerSec attribute

      • getInterDcStreamThroughputOutboundMegabitsPerSec

        @Nullable
Integer getInterDcStreamThroughputOutboundMegabitsPerSec()
        Throttles all streaming file transfer between the datacenters. This setting allows throttles streaming throughput betweens data centers in addition to throttling all network stream traffic as configured with stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec.
        Returns:
        The value of the interDcStreamThroughputOutboundMegabitsPerSec attribute

      • getDataFileDirectories

        @Nullable
Collection<String> getDataFileDirectories()

        Returns:
        The value of the dataFileDirectories attribute

      • getSavedCachesDirectory

        @Nullable
String getSavedCachesDirectory()

      • getCommitlogDirectory

        @Nullable
String getCommitlogDirectory()
        The directory where the commit log is stored.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitlogDirectory attribute

      • getCommitlogTotalSpaceInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getCommitlogTotalSpaceInMb()
        Total space used for commitlogs. If the used space goes above this value, Cassandra rounds up to the next nearest segment multiple and flushes memtables to disk for the oldest commitlog segments, removing those log segments. This reduces the amount of data to replay on start-up, and prevents infrequently-updated tables from indefinitely keeping commitlog segments. A small total commitlog space tends to cause more flush activity on less-active tables.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitlogTotalSpaceInMb attribute

      • getCommitlogSync

        @Nullable
CommitLogSync getCommitlogSync()
        Policy for commit log sync.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitlogSync attribute

      • getCommitlogSyncBatchWindowInMs

        @Nullable
Double getCommitlogSyncBatchWindowInMs()
        When in batch mode, Cassandra won’t ack writes until the commit log has been fsynced to disk. It will wait getCommitlogSyncBatchWindowInMs between fsyncs.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitlogSyncBatchWindowInMs attribute

      • getCommitlogSyncPeriodInMs

        @Nullable
Long getCommitlogSyncPeriodInMs()
        When in periodic mode, the CommitLog is simply synced every getCommitlogSyncPeriodInMs.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitlogSyncPeriodInMs attribute

      • getCommitlogSegmentSizeInMb

        @Nullable
Long getCommitlogSegmentSizeInMb()
        the size of the individual commitlog file segments. A commitlog segment may be archived, deleted, or recycled after all its data has been flushed to SSTables. This amount of data can potentially include commitlog segments from every table in the system. The default size is usually suitable for most commitlog archiving, but if you want a finer granularity, 8 or 16 MB is reasonable. This property determines the maximum mutation size, defined as half the segment size. If a mutation's size exceeds the maximum mutation size, the mutation is rejected. Before increasing the commitlog segment size of the commitlog segments, investigate why the mutations are larger than expected. Look for underlying issues with access patterns and data model, because increasing the commitlog segment size is a limited fix.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitlogSegmentSizeInMb attribute

      • getCommitlogCompression

        @Nullable
ParameterizedClass getCommitlogCompression()
        Compression to apply to the commit log. If omitted, the commit log will be written uncompressed.
        Returns:
        The value of the commitlogCompression attribute

      • getTransparentDataEncryptionOptions

        @Nullable
TransparentDataEncryptionOptions getTransparentDataEncryptionOptions()
        Enables encrypting data at-rest (on disk).
        Returns:
        The value of the transparentDataEncryptionOptions attribute

      • getMaxMutationSizeInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getMaxMutationSizeInKb()
        If a mutation's size exceeds this value, the mutation is rejected. Before increasing the commitlog segment size of the commitlog segments, investigate why the mutations are larger than expected. Look for underlying issues with access patterns and data model, because increasing the commitlog segment size is a limited fix.
        Returns:
        The value of the maxMutationSizeInKb attribute

      • getHintedHandoffThrottleInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getHintedHandoffThrottleInKb()
        Maximum amount of traffic per delivery thread in kilobytes per second. This rate reduces proportionally to the number of nodes in the cluster. For example, if there are two nodes in the cluster, each delivery thread uses the maximum rate. If there are three, each node throttles to half of the maximum, since the two nodes are expected to deliver hints simultaneously.
        Returns:
        The value of the hintedHandoffThrottleInKb attribute

      • getBatchlogReplayThrottleInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getBatchlogReplayThrottleInKb()
        Total maximum throttle for replaying hints. Throttling is reduced proportionally to the number of nodes in the cluster.
        Returns:
        The value of the batchlogReplayThrottleInKb attribute

      • getMaxHintsDeliveryThreads

        @Nullable
Integer getMaxHintsDeliveryThreads()
        Number of threads Cassandra uses to deliver hints. In multiple data-center deployments, consider increasing this number because cross data-center handoff is generally slower.
        Returns:
        The value of the maxHintsDeliveryThreads attribute

      • getHintsFlushPeriodInMs

        The value of the hintsCompression attribute

      • getSstablePreemptiveOpenIntervalInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getSstablePreemptiveOpenIntervalInMb()
        When compacting, the replacement opens SSTables before they are completely written and uses in place of the prior SSTables for any range previously written. This setting helps to smoothly transfer reads between the SSTables by reducing page cache churn and keeps hot rows hot.
        Returns:
        The value of the sstablePreemptiveOpenIntervalInMb attribute

      • getIncrementalBackups

        @Nullable
Boolean getIncrementalBackups()
        Backs up data updated since the last snapshot was taken. When enabled, Cassandra creates a hard link to each SSTable flushed or streamed locally in a backups/ subdirectory of the keyspace data. Removing these links is the operator's responsibility.
        Returns:
        The value of the incrementalBackups attribute

      • getTrickleFsync

        @Nullable
Boolean getTrickleFsync()
        When doing sequential writing, enabling this option tells fsync to force the operating system to flush the dirty buffers at a set interval trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb. Enable this parameter to avoid sudden dirty buffer flushing from impacting read latencies. Recommended to use on SSDs, but not on HDDs.
        Returns:
        The value of the trickleFsync attribute

      • getTrickleFsyncIntervalInKb

        @Nullable
Integer getTrickleFsyncIntervalInKb()
        Size of the fsync in kilobytes.
        Returns:
        The value of the trickleFsyncIntervalInKb attribute

      • getKeyCacheSizeInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getKeyCacheSizeInMb()
        A global cache setting for tables. It is the maximum size of the key cache in memory. When no value is set, the cache is set to the smaller of 5% of the available heap, or 100MB. To disable set to 0.
        Returns:
        The value of the keyCacheSizeInMb attribute

      • getKeyCacheSavePeriod

        @Nullable
Long getKeyCacheSavePeriod()
        Duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Caches are saved to saved_caches_directory. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O.
        Returns:
        The value of the keyCacheSavePeriod attribute

      • getKeyCacheKeysToSave

        @Nullable
Integer getKeyCacheKeysToSave()
        Number of keys from the key cache to save.
        Returns:
        The value of the keyCacheKeysToSave attribute

      • getRowCacheClassName

        @Nullable
String getRowCacheClassName()
        The classname of the row cache provider to use.
        Returns:
        The value of the rowCacheClassName attribute

      • getRowCacheSizeInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getRowCacheSizeInMb()
        Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. If you reduce the size, you may not get you hottest keys loaded on start up.
        Returns:
        The value of the rowCacheSizeInMb attribute

      • getRowCacheSavePeriod

        @Nullable
Long getRowCacheSavePeriod()
        Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. Caches are saved to saved_caches_directory. This setting has limited use as described in row_cache_size_in_mb.
        Returns:
        The value of the rowCacheSavePeriod attribute

      • getRowCacheKeysToSave

        @Nullable
Integer getRowCacheKeysToSave()
        Number of keys from the row cache to save.
        Returns:
        The value of the rowCacheKeysToSave attribute

      • getCounterCacheSizeInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getCounterCacheSizeInMb()
        When no value is specified a minimum of 2.5% of Heap or 50MB. If you perform counter deletes and rely on low gc_grace_seconds, you should disable the counter cache. To disable, set to 0.
        Returns:
        The value of the counterCacheSizeInMb attribute

      • getCounterCacheSavePeriod

        @Nullable
Long getCounterCacheSavePeriod()
        Duration after which Cassandra should save the counter cache (keys only). Caches are saved to saved_caches_directory.
        Returns:
        The value of the counterCacheSavePeriod attribute

      • getCounterCacheKeysToSave

        @Nullable
Integer getCounterCacheKeysToSave()
        Number of keys from the counter cache to save. When disabled all keys are saved.
        Returns:
        The value of the counterCacheKeysToSave attribute

        Returns:
        The value of the fileCacheSizeInMb attribute

      • getBufferPoolUseHeapIfExhausted

        @Nullable
Boolean getBufferPoolUseHeapIfExhausted()
        ﻿Indicates whether Cassandra allocates allocate on-heap or off-heap memory when the SSTable buffer pool is exhausted (when the buffer pool has exceeded the maximum memory file_cache_size_in_mb), beyond this amount, Cassandra stops caching buffers, but allocates on request.
        Returns:

      • getTombstoneFailureThreshold

        @Nullable
Integer getTombstoneFailureThreshold()
        The maximum number of tombstones a query can scan before aborting.
        Returns:

      • getIndexSummaryCapacityInMb

        @Nullable
Integer getIndexSummaryCapacityInMb()
        Fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. If the memory usage of all index summaries exceeds this limit, any SSTables with low read rates shrink their index summaries to meet this limit. This is a best-effort process. In extreme conditions, Cassandra may need to use more than this amount of memory.
        Returns:
        The value of the indexSummaryCapacityInMb attribute

      • getIndexSummaryResizeIntervalInMinutes

        @Nullable
Integer getIndexSummaryResizeIntervalInMinutes()
        How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates. To disable, set to -1. This leaves existing index summaries at their current sampling level.
        Returns:
        The value of the indexSummaryResizeIntervalInMinutes attribute

      • getGcLogThresholdInMs

        @Nullable
Long getGcLogThresholdInMs()
        GC Pauses greater than 200 ms will be logged at INFO level This threshold can be adjusted to minimize logging if necessary.
        Returns:
        The value of the gcLogThresholdInMs attribute

      • getGcWarnThresholdInMs

        @Nullable
Long getGcWarnThresholdInMs()
        GC Pauses greater than gc_warn_threshold_in_ms will be logged at WARN level Adjust the threshold based on your application throughput requirement. Setting to 0 will deactivate the feature.
        Returns:
        The value of the gcWarnThresholdInMs attribute

      • getOtcCoalescingEnoughCoalescedMessages

        @Nullable

      • getOtcBacklogExpirationIntervalMs

        @Nullable
Long getOtcBacklogExpirationIntervalMs()
        How many milliseconds to wait between two expiration runs on the backlog (queue) of the OutboundTcpConnection.
        Returns:
        The value of the otcBacklogExpirationIntervalMs attribute

      • getWindowsTimerInterval

        @Nullable
Integer getWindowsTimerInterval()
        The default Windows kernel timer and scheduling resolution is 15.6ms for power conservation. Lowering this value on Windows can provide much tighter latency and better throughput, however some virtualized environments may see a negative performance impact from changing this setting below their system default. The sysinternals ‘clockres’ tool can confirm your system’s default setting.
        Returns:
        The value of the windowsTimerInterval attribute

      • getPreparedStatementsCacheSizeMb

        @Nullable
Integer getPreparedStatementsCacheSizeMb()
        Maximum size of the native protocol prepared statement cache.
        Returns:
        The value of the preparedStatementsCacheSizeMb attribute

      • getEnableUserDefinedFunctions

        @Nullable
Boolean getEnableUserDefinedFunctions()
        If unset, all GC Pauses greater than gc_log_threshold_in_ms will log at INFO level UDFs (user defined functions) are disabled by default. As of Cassandra 3.0 there is a sandbox in place that should prevent execution of evil code.
        Returns:
        The value of the enableUserDefinedFunctions attribute

      • getEnableScriptedUserDefinedFunctions

        @Nullable
Boolean getEnableScriptedUserDefinedFunctions()
        Enables scripted UDFs (JavaScript UDFs). Java UDFs are always enabled, if enable_user_defined_functions is true. Enable this option to be able to use UDFs with “language javascript” or any custom JSR-223 provider. This option has no effect, if enable_user_defined_functions is false.
        Returns:
        The value of the enableScriptedUserDefinedFunctions attribute

      • getBackPressureEnabled

        @Nullable
Boolean getBackPressureEnabled()
        Back-pressure settings (If enabled) the coordinator will apply the back-pressure strategy specified below to each mutation sent to replicas, with the aim of reducing pressure on overloaded replicas.
        Returns:
        The value of the backPressureEnabled attribute

      • getBackPressureStrategy

        @Nullable
ParameterizedClass getBackPressureStrategy()
        The backpressure strategy.
        Returns:
        The value of the backPressureStrategy attribute

      • getDiskAccessMode

        @Nullable
DiskAccessMode getDiskAccessMode()
        Policy for data disk access mode.
        Returns:
        The value of the diskAccessMode attribute

      • builder

        @Nonnull
static Config.Builder builder()
        Create a new builder to build a Config.
        Returns:
        a fresh Builder.
